results.title: Aspects of behaviour (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Bruce Hart and Communication Research Media Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Psychology Today”.
Relating psychology to the student’s life experience this film considers ethical issues such as obedience and authority along with prejudice and attitude change. It also examines questions like: what does a social psychologist do? How does physiology relate to behaviour? Do psychologists often agree? What is cultural psychology?

results.title: Askja on fire: volcanic eruption in Iceland 1961
results.brief_description: Shows the massive eruption of the volcano Askja in the central highlands of Iceland in 1961. Presents contrasting scenes of the glowing molten lava against a background of snow and ice. Narrated by Brian D. Holt. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Asking Around
results.creator_credit: Richard Greenhalgh, Kim Montgomery and ACMI
results.brief_description: Shaun Tan (author and co-director)describes some of his original concepts for the book of ‘The Lost Thing’ and how these were translated and changed for the film adaptation. Other interviewees Tom Bryant (3D artist)and Leo Baker (animator)discuss points of similarity and difference between the book and film.

results.title: Ask an Australian about the outdoors [Turkish version]
results.creator_credit: Kay Roberts and Artransa Park Studios
results.brief_description: A family setting out on a picnic prepare by taking adequate food, water and first aid equipment. The danger of fire in the bush is emphasised, and the film also stresses the need to protect the fauna. Note: In Turkish.
results.title_for_label: Ask an Australian about the outdoors [Turkish version]

results.title: Ask an Australian about surfing [Turkish version]
results.creator_credit: Alex Ezard and Artransa Park Studios
results.brief_description: Shows the dangers of swimming in the surf. The role that surf life-saving clubs play on a surf beach is explained. The importance of observing safety precautions, such as swimming between the flags and clearing the water when the shark alarm is sounded is emphasised Note: In Turkish.
results.description: Shows the dangers of swimming in the surf. The role that surf life-saving clubs play on a surf beach is explained.
